events.name: AngelHack Fall 2012 Silicon Valley
events.about:
Get excited Silicon Valley! AngelHack’s 24-hour Hackathon competition is back and this time we’re bigger than ever! Join us for our Fall 2012 edition, where you can find:

  • Over 400 amazing developers & designers to work with
  • Gourmet food, shwag, nerf guns, helicopters, and at select locations- AR drones and free massages
  • Over $650,000 in prizes, including acceptance into AngelHacks Hackcelerator program and trips to Silicon Valley (more details below and on our FAQ)
  • Media coverage and immediate attention for your hackathon project to get taken to the next level
  • An awesome community of mentors, influencers, and expert judges to help you along the way

Transportation shuttles from Berkeley - San Francisco - Paypal will be provided if you need a ride. 

What should I build?
Create a prototype (hack) of something that you believe solves a big problem. You dont need a business plan or anything crazy like that, but you should be able to show the big idea potential of your hack. AngelHack is a launchpad for you to flush out and validate projects youve always wanted to build. Previous winners include: Appetas, GiveGo, TapFame, SnapStore, ShareBrowse, Kloutron, & Blue Dragon Security.

What are the rules?
All code must be FRESH. Prior to the hackathon you can create your design, wireframes, logo, and user flows. You can even build hardware. But to make things completely fair you can not write any code whatsoever until the hackathon starts. All code must be built at AngelHack.

For more info visit our Rules and FAQ pages.

Good Luck,
Gregory Gopman
AngelHack Founder / CEO

As seen in

events.name: NFC HACK Hosted at San Jose State University
events.about:
Official Website: http://sjsunfchackathon.wordpress.com/

*Note: When signing-up, verification (Student ID, Alumni Card) must be presented upon registration at the start of the event if you are registered under SJSU Student or SJSU Almuni. 

*Note: If you are NOT a SJSU affiliated attendee, you must bring your drivers license/state ID and be prepared to show it at the registration table. Although we do wish for some professional developers to attend, if you were not invited by a SJSU student or SJSU affiliate, then your registration may be deleted without notice. We apologize for the inconvenience.

*Note: Early bird registration is free until further notice.

Event Description:

Participants will arrive at the Student Union (SU) and register in the Costanoan Room starting at 1pm, and may begin team formation and working immediately. They will work throughout the night in the SU and into the morning hours. At noon the following day (December 1st), they will submit their projects via email and judging will begin promptly after.

Food, drinks, and an exciting hack environment will be provided by NFC Hack.

This is the first ever 24-hour event at the Student Union - so join us in making history and lets show everyone what SJSU has got!

When:

November 30th at 1:00pm – December 1st at 4:00pm

Where:

Student Union 3rd Floor – meet in Almaden and Costanoan rooms

Rules & Guidelines

Schedule:

Registration: Begins at 1pm Friday Nov. 30th

Opening Presentation & Welcome Reception: 1:30pm-2pm

Development/work Time: Friday 2pm - Saturday 12pm

Judging: Saturday 1pm - 3:30pm

Category Winners Announced: 3:30pm-4pm

Click here for detailed schedule information
events.address: Student Union Almaden and Costanoan rooms

events.name: #hackLynbrook - Lynbrook High School\'s first hackathon.
events.about:
#hackLynbrook

WHAT?

#hackLynbrook is more than just your traditional hackathon. #hackLynbrook is a hackathon with a misison; to build technologies to help improve the education expierence. Designers, developers, students and teachers will form teams in order to create the best hack to help students or teachers in 30 hours. Teams will go through 2 rounds of judging and the top 3 teams for each category (student tech and teacher tech) will get prizes!
Register now! Space is limited!

Tickets are available at http://hacklynbrook.eventbrite.com/

Who is eligible?

  • Developers & Designers (Professional, amateur, freelance, anyone who can code)
  • High School students (Doesn't matter what school)
  • Teachers (Doesn't matter what school)

Prizes

  • 1st Place Team: Treehouse Accounts
  • 2nd Place Team: Khan Academy Totebags
  • 3rd Place Team: iTunes Gift Cards

events.name: Sprint Developer Program Hackathon
events.about:
CALLING ALL MOBILE DEVELOPERS!

Join the Sprint Developer Program and WIP on Tuesday, October 23 in San Jose for the official hackathon of the Sprint Open Solutions Conference. Sprint wants to see your best apps, andhas stacks of cash and devices for prizes -- and the top app will get special recognition during Thursday evenings keynote from Sprint CEO Dan Hesse. Youll get a chance to meet and get direct support from the Sprint Developer Program, as well as a host of great API and developer tool providers. All attendees will also get a code to register for FREE for the Sprint Open Solutions Conference ($350 value) when they attend the hackathon (these codes will be distributed onsite)!

Whatever your platform of choice or your area of expertise, youre welcome to join the fun (and if you dont have a team, well help you find one). The categories for the competition will be (subject to change):

  • Best in Show - the top overall app will win great prizes and be recognized during Sprint CEO Dan Hesses Thursday evening keynote address.
  • Best NFC App - show us what you can do with NFC in any type of app, not just payments!
  • Best HTML5/Hybrid App - HTML5 is the next big thing, but lots of you are kicking butt with it already, and we want to see!
  • Samsung categories - Compete to create unique UI experiences using the S Pen SDK and bring new apps to life across multiple screens with the AllShare SDK. Veterans and newbies can enter and demonstrate how to bring their apps to a new level, using Samsung’s world class offerings.
  • Best Commerce App - Sell us something! Show us apps that integrate with mobile wallets, make mobile payments or offer the best retail experience.
  • Best Use of Mobile Advertising - successfully using mobile ads in your app means more than just slapping them in as an afterthought. We want to see the apps that most effectively use ads with the best UX.
  • Stay tuned for more special categories and prizes from our partners!

For your $20 registration fee, youll receive:
  • Meals and snacks during the hackathon
  • A chance to win thousands of dollars in cash and prizes
  • a FREE registration for the Sprint Open Solutions Conference ($375)
  • Freebies and giveaways from our partners
  • And more!
Heres the agenda of events (subject to change):
Tuesday, October 23
  • 9:00am - Registration Opens
  • 10:00am - Welcome and Introduction, Category and Competition Review, Lightning Talks from API/Tool Partners
  • 11:30am - Lunch (provided) + Apps Clinic - get advice and feedback on your app concept from Sprint and partner experts
  • 1:00pm - Official start of coding!
  • 6:00pm - Evening reception/dinner
  • 9:00pm - Venue closes for the evening. You can keep on coding, youll just need to find your own spot to do it!
Wednesday, October 24
  • 9:00am - Venue reopens for the day
  • 12:00pm - Apps are due! Well have lunch and start the demos.
  • 2:00pm (TBC) - Category winners and Best in Show Finalists are announced
Thursday, October 25
  • TBD - Best in Show Winner announced during evening keynote

events.name: PayPal Hackathon
events.about:
Prizes
First place receives $5,000!
Second Place receives $2,500!
Third place receives $1,000!

Additionally, participants nominated by their fellow participants in the following categories will recieve an iPad for:

Most Helpful
Most Entertaining
Most Ambitious

The Schedule
September 21, 4:00pm. The doors open for the 2012 Hackathon.
September 21, 5:00pm. Keynote, rules, kickoff.
September 21, 5:30pm. The event officially begins.
September 21, 7:00pm. Dinner is available for all participants.
September 22, 12:00am. Late-night food available for the participants.
September 22, 8:00am. Breakfast becomes available.
September 22, 12:00pm. Lunch becomes available.
September 22, 5:00pm. The event officially closes, judging begins, and dinner is available.
September 22, 7:00pm. Prizes are awarded for the top three teams, and top 3 participants.
September 22, 7:30pm. The Social begins.
September 22, 11:00pm. Doors close.

Judging Criteria
Each entry will be given three minutes to demo their finished entry. The following criteria are the basis of what the judges will be using to determine the winner. No powerpoint slides, please; we just want to see your awesome creation.

Integration: how well does the submission use PayPals unique capabilities?
Utility: how useful is the submission to the end user?
User Experience: how easy is the submission to use?
Innovation: how unique and innovative is the submission? 

Rules

  • The development tools, frameworks and application focus are entirely up to the participants but they must use PayPal in some way.
  • Submission cannot be under development prior to the start of the hackathon at 5:30pm on September 21.
  • Participants are expected to bring all tools and software necessary to build their entry. Organizers will provide food, caffeine, Internet access, and power strips, but you might want to bring your own as well.
  • Employees, contractors, and partners of PayPal are welcome to participate in the hackathon, but are not eligible to receive prizes.
  • To participate, submissions must be received by 5:00pm on September 22. Participants are strongly encouraged to pre-register to assure enough food and seating, but participants may join on the contest at any time prior to the submission deadline.
  • Participants may work by themselves or in a team.
  • Rules are subject to change at the discretion of PayPal.

If you have questions, please reach out to us here or at our LinkedIn discussion group or email us at hackathon@paypal.com.

events.name: Hack the Future 5
events.about:
Are you a 5th-12th grade student who wants to learn more about computers than they teach you in school? Then its time to start teaching yourself! 

  

Hack the Future is an all-day party / hackathon for youth, to show you what its like to be a hacker and see if its for you. We wont tell you what to do. Youll be free to work on whatever you want. Well try to keep you from getting stuck, and well give you a place to start, if you want one. This is a unique opportunity to learn the the state of the art in software engineering from the people who do it for a living.

 

 

Parents, dont reserve a ticket for yourself. Once youve signed the waiver, we encourage you to let your children learn on their own! If you want to stay and join in, youre welcome, but we wont have a T-shirt for you.

Bring a laptop for programming and signed waiver and medical information sheet. The waiver and required medical information sheet are available on hackthefuture.org.

 


Suggested donation: $10

You can also donate through Fundly

Like us on Facebook

 

 


To learn more or sign up for our mailing lists, find out about more Hack the Future events, or see pictures from the first Hack the Future, visit http://www.hackthefuture.org. You can also visit our Facebook page here

events.name: iOSDevCamp 2012
events.about:
iOSDevCamp 2012

Friday July 20, 2012 - Sunday July 22, 2012
PayPal (eBay) Offices
2161 N 1st Street
San Jose, California 95131
Get Directions
Who: Developers, designers, entrepreneurs for iOS.

What: 3-day weekend event, in the format of past iPhoneDevCamps and iPadDevCamp.

When: July 20-22, 2012

Where: PayPal (eBay) in San Jose, CA.

Why: We love the developer community!

How: It will cost a small amount to attend, with additional event costs offset by sponsors.


The event is inspired by BarCamp, SuperHappyDevHouse, and MacHack, to develop Cocoa Touch and Web-based applications for Apples iOS. This follows the previous events - iOSDevCamp 2011 at PayPal in San Jose, iPadDevCamp at PayPal in San Jose, and iPhoneDevCamp events held at Adobe Systems in San Francisco, July 2007 and August 2008, Yahoo! in 2009. Out-of-town guests are welcome.

Attendees will include iOS developers, web developers, UI designers, entrepreneurs and testers, all working together over the weekend. Development projects will include both solo and team efforts. While some attendees will wish to work solo during the event, we encourage attendees to team up, based on expertise, to work in ad-hoc project development teams. All attendees should be prepared to work on a development project during the event.

Attendees will be able to:

 

    • Create new applications for iOS.

 

    • Migrate Mac OS X applications to iOS.

 

    • Test and optimize applications for iOS.

 

The event will feature:

 

    • Simultaneous Events Worldwide

 

    • Meetup Time on Friday with Refreshments

 

    • Catered Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner on Saturday and Sunday

 

    • Saturday Keynote (now accepting nominations)

 

    • Open Mic for Questions

 

    • Ad Hoc Sessions by Participants

 

    • Late Saturday Gaming

 

    • Sunday Keynote (now accepting nominations)

 

    • Hackathon Contest

 

    • Everyone Leaves with Something

 

We are committed to staying not-for-profit; all charges will go toward the production of iOSDevCamp, and the organizers dont make a cent. The organizers are Raven Zachary, Dom Sagolla, Christopher Allen, and Jennifer Holmes. We are currently seeking:

 

    • Sponsors

 

    • Keynote Speakers

 

  • Donations

To get involved with the above, please email Raven, Dom, Christopher and Jennifer: info@iphonedevcamp.org.
